medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing headaches associated with nausea and vomiting, and difficulty with the left side of her body.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 weeks prior to hospitalization and progressed to include frequent bumping into objects with the left side of her body and left limbs.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient underwent exploratory neck surgery for primary hyperparathyroidism in April 2001. The patient is presumed to have hereditary hyperparathyroidism. She had concomitant papillary and follicular carcinomas of the thyroid.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a history of surgery for a parathyroid tumor and is presumed to have hereditary hyperparathyroidism.
